boilerSASS | Documentation

How To Install

You can choose between two different kind of installation: only boilerSASS, or boilerSASS with some third party libraries.
In order to install only BoilerSASS, download the package and follow this steps:

  • Install NPM components
    Open you system console and access BoilerSASS directory on your desktop
    the type $ npm install
  • Using SASS
    Once BoilerSASS is installed you can start coding Sass
    Type $ Grunt on your console to first BoilerSASS compile and to start the watch task that autocomile SASS files when changed.

If you want add some libraries follow this steps:

  • Install NPM components
    Open you system console and access BoilerSASS directory on your desktop
    the type $ npm install
  • Configure package
    Open the file config.json and set as true the libraries that you want include on your sass project.
  • Install vendors libs
    Open you system console and access BoilerSASS directory on your desktop
    then type $ Grunt install
  • Using SASS
    Once BoilerSASS is installed you can start coding Sass
    Type $ Grunt on your console to first BoilerSASS compile and to start the watch task that autocomile SASS files when changed.

Now you are ready!

Usage

Using boilerSASS in very simple. As HTML5 Boilerplate it provides all basical files for a new web project.
Inside the package you can find the html, javascript and sass file that you can customize as you need.

For a first massive customization you can edit the file sass/_variables.css according your design, then you can place your style inside sass/_custom.scss file.
You can compile sass files using Grunt that is included in boilerSASS. Launch sass compile and watch task simply typing $Grunt on your console.

Customization

By default, boilerSASS provides a _custom.scss partial file for place your sass style, but you can add any partials files you want.

Add a partial file

Create a new file inside sass/partials directory and name it like _newpartial.scss, the open sass/boilerSass.scss and find the row
@import 'custom';
and append it a new row to include the new partials
@import 'partials/newpartial';

boilerSASS | Variables

All available sass variables

Variable Name Desc Group
$space Default space, used for margins and paddings Sizes
$margin Default margin, this property use the $space value as default Sizes
$padding Default padding, this property use the $space value as default Sizes
$color_1 $color_1_hover
$color_2 $color_2_hover
$color_3 $color_3_hover
$color_4 $color_4_hover

boilerSASS | Mixins

All available mixins

Mixin Desc Group
button()

Returns a button with default colors. Params: no params

Buttons
button-color($background,$color)

Returns a button with custom colors. Params: $background,$color

 Buttons
button-icon($icon)

Returns a button with a custom icon. Params: $icon

Note: $icon must be the font code of the icon tha you want show. The icon font family is defined on variable $font-icon-1 in _variables.scss

 Buttons
button-icon-left()

Aligns icons to the left. This mixin must be used only with button-icon() mixin. "Left" is the default button icon align. Params: no params

 Buttons
button-icon-right()

Aligns icons to the right. This mixin must be used only with button-icon() mixin. Params: no params

 Buttons
resetlist()

Reset list with no style. Params: no params

 Typography
ellipsis()

Add "..." ellipsis to the text overflow. Params: no params

 Typography
place($top,$right,$bottom,$left)

Add top, right, bottom and left positioning. Params: $top,$right,$bottom,$left

Note: you can use px or %

 Typography
transition( $property, $duration, $style)

Add a transition with prefixes. Params: $property, $duration, $style

 Transitions
transform( $transformProperties )

Add custom transform properties with prefixes. Params: $transformProperties

Note: $transformProperties must be a CSS3 trasform valid rule

 Transforms
translate ( $x, $y )

Add custom transform translate properties with prefixes. Params: $x,$y

Note: $x,$y can be a fixed size or a liquid size

 Transforms
translate-50()
translate-50X()
translate-50Y()

Add a -50% translate on X and Y axis. Params: no params

 Transforms
ratio_[ratio]
ratio_custom($padding)

ratio mixin generate a fluid box with permanent ratio. You can use some default ratio or geretate your own with the ratio_custom() mixin.
Default Ratios Mixins
- ratio_16-9
- ratio_5-3
- ratio_3-2
- ratio_1-2
- ratio_1-1

Params: no params
Custom Ratio Mixins
For custom ratio, use ratio_custom($padding); Params: is the percent of the with that will be used as a box height;
Box Content
The box content must be placed inside a child element that require the mixin: ratio_content

Element Style
